result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leslie J Lemens

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

4:02 PM Defendant Leslie J Lemens in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Leslie J Lemens.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. COurt reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel requests another date.  Defendant has another attorney assigned by SPD for different case, wishes to hire attorney from the other case for both cases.  State has no objection. Court Appointed Attorney paperwork given to defendant. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:33 AM   Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leslie J Lemens in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Leslie J Lemens.  Court reviews events in file, reviews amended complaint with defendant.  Defense waives reading of the complaint and amended complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Atty Viel to set prelim. date with JA Parks after court today.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Leslie J Lemens in court.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Leslie J Lemens.   Court reviews events in file.  Atty Viel requests balance of IA be set after 8/01/22 to allow his office to look into an issue regarding legal representation of defendant.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
from defendant to Court re: bond modification

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - Medium Level.

1:15 PM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leslie J Lemens appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Leslie J Lemens.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.   Atty Viel requests balance of IA be set to give SPD time to look into whether defendant qualifies for not.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
